items.name: Boolean
constructor
items.text: Creates a new boolean object.

items.name: value
items.text: Either a truthy or falsy value to create the corresponding Boolean object.

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: toLocaleString
items.text:
Returns a string representing the object. This method is meant to be overridden by derived objects
for locale-specific purposes.

`{@link Object}`'s `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}` returns the result of calling `{@link #method!toString toString}`.

This function is provided to give objects a generic `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}` method, even though not all
may use it. Currently, only `{@link Array}`, `{@link Number}`, and `{@link Date}` override `{@link #method!toLocaleString toLocaleString}`.
Object represented as a string.

items.name: toString
items.text:
Returns a string of either "true" or "false" depending upon the value of the object.
Overrides the `Object.prototype.toString` method.

The Boolean object overrides the `{@link #method!toString toString}` method of the `{@link Object}` object; it does not inherit
`Object.toString`. For Boolean objects, the `{@link #method!toString toString}` method returns a string representation of
the object.

JavaScript calls the `{@link #method!toString toString}` method automatically when a Boolean is to be represented as a text
value or when a Boolean is referred to in a string concatenation.

For Boolean objects and values, the built-in `{@link #method!toString toString}` method returns the string `"true"` or
`"false"` depending on the value of the boolean object. In the following code, `flag.toString`
returns `"true"`.

    var flag = new Boolean(true)
    var myVar = flag.toString()
The boolean value represented as a string.

items.name: valueOf
items.text:
Returns the primitive value of the `{@link Boolean}` object. Overrides the `Object.prototype.valueOf` method.

The `{@link #method!valueOf valueOf}` method of Boolean returns the primitive value of a Boolean object or literal Boolean
as a Boolean data type.

This method is usually called internally by JavaScript and not explicitly in code.

    x = new Boolean();
    myVar = x.valueOf()      //assigns false to myVar
The primitive value.

items.name: constructor
prototype
items.text: Allows the addition of properties to all objects of type Object.
